children.subject: So for tutoring upper division courses, we should only fill out the Google form?  (Because the standard Academic Student Employee Application only lists the lower division classes)
Or is there no formal hiring for upper-div tutors at all?
there is no formal hiring of upper division tutors. You can complete the google form, but this form is not for "formal hiring".

If you'd like to add yourself to the department roster of available private tutors, please complete this google form. More information can be found on the page. You may add yourself to this roster and apply above.

http://goo.gl/forms/fUWICNAPwFJ2UOVl2. For the private tutor roster only, we have enough tutors for CS 61A, 61B, 61C, 70, &7 EE 16A. We are primarily seeking tutors for upper division courses.

1. It is unlikely that any courses will hire 10 hour tutors. More information about what numbers faculty will assign to their hires is not available until offers are made. 

2. I don't believe there to be a preference. As long as the student has taken the course, they will be considered. Of course grad students (who did ugrad elsewhere) are less likely to have taken undergrad courses, and undergrads are less likely to have taken the graduate courses we hire for.
Which courses are looking for 10 hour tutors? And is there any preference given to graduate students over undergraduate? Thanks!

From Facebook response: Accepted way is go to Unofficial Transcript on bearfacts, click show name, print and then select Save as PDF as the printer


Tutors are responsible for helping students learn and practice material, normally in a group setting. Readers are responsible for grading homework assignments and problem sets, they do not teach.
Where can we get a PDF of our transcript? And what is the difference between the reader and tutor positions?

Where are the links to the actual applications? When I open the above link I only find a description of the role and the applications for lab assisting. 

Thanks!

history.content:
The Fall 2016 Reader & Tutor applications are now available on our website. We encourage you to apply soon, as applicant names will start being forwarded to faculty next week. 

A few notes:

  • You must have received a B or better in the course for which you are applying and have an overall GPA of 3.0 to be eligible.
    • 61A & B will only be hiring Tutors. You must complete the tutor application to be considered.
    • 61C, 70, 16A, & 16B are hiring both Readers & Tutors. You may complete either application, or both. You will only be considered for positions you applied for.
    • Reader hiring will continue through the first few weeks of the semester, dependent on faculty decisions.
    • The pay for a Reader/Tutor position is available here: Current Rates
history.subject: Apply to be a Reader or Tutor for Fall 2016 EECS courses
